<!-- If you need help or think you have found a bug, please help us with your issue by entering the following information (otherwise you can delete this text): -->

Output of `helm version`: `2.16.5`

Output of `kubectl version`: no need of any `kubectl` infos to accurately describe my issue, plus it would not make sense to.

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): same as for `kubectl`


> of

Hi Helm Team, my issue is about installing helm, sha256sums of downloadable released binaries are corrupted or not managed : 

```bash
jbl@poste-devops-jbl-16gbram:~/siecle$ curl -LO https://get.helm.sh/helm-v2.16.5-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100    65  100    65    0     0     86      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--    86
jbl@poste-devops-jbl-16gbram:~/siecle$ cat helm-v2.16.5-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256 
7cd54f56f787d62fd7311d5ae2c26e31310d37d27e3622014e5c769bec008cab
jbl@poste-devops-jbl-16gbram:~/siecle$ cat checksumsjbl 
7cd54f56f787d62fd7311d5ae2c26e31310d37d27e3622014e5c769bec008cab ./helm-v2.16.5-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256
jbl@poste-devops-jbl-16gbram:~/siecle$ sha256sum 
^C
jbl@poste-devops-jbl-16gbram:~/siecle$ sha256sum -c ./helm-v2.16.5-linux-amd64.tar.gz
sha256sum: ./helm-v2.16.5-linux-amd64.tar.gz: no properly formatted SHA256 checksum lines found
jbl@poste-devops-jbl-16gbram:~/siecle$ sha256sum -c ./checksumsjbl 
./helm-v2.16.5-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256: FAILED
sha256sum: WARNING: 1 computed checksum did NOT match
jbl@poste-devops-jbl-16gbram:~/siecle$ ls -allg
total 24708
drwxr-xr-x  2 jbl     4096 Mar 29 17:43 .
drwxr-xr-x 97 jbl    12288 Mar 29 17:36 ..
-rw-r--r--  1 jbl      106 Mar 29 17:41 checksumsjbl
-rw-r--r--  1 jbl 25273394 Mar 29 17:41 helm-v2.16.5-linux-amd64.tar.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 jbl       65 Mar 29 17:43 helm-v2.16.5-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256
jbl@poste-devops-jbl-16gbram:~/siecle$ 
```

So now I am bound to build helm from source to get a production grade secure installation of Helm.

Additionnaly, the build from source documentation is not obviously found. That is really unfriendly, if not surprising. 

As far as I can get, it looks like you are at the "just get the source and check my GPG signature on commits and or tags" level. 

I would gladly propose my contribution on providing documentation management into helm project, if desired.
